Dear Chairman,

I am writing to you today as a concerned citizen who firmly believes in the power of the media to shed light on critical issues affecting our society. It has come to my attention that an alarming situation is unfolding at the southern borders of our nation‚Äîa situation that demands immediate attention and action.

According to credible reports and testimonies from various sources, including nonprofit organizations dedicated to combating human trafficking, it is estimated that a staggering $14 million is being generated daily through the heinous crime of child sex trafficking at our southern borders. This horrifying reality is a stark reminder that innocent children, our fellow human beings, are being exploited and subjected to unimaginable suffering for the greed of others.

What is deeply troubling is the apparent lack of effort or urgency displayed by our current presidential administration in addressing this pressing issue. The fact that such a massive and reprehensible crime is allowed to persist under their watch raises serious questions about their commitment to protecting the most vulnerable among us. As concerned citizens, we must not turn a blind eye to this grave injustice.

It is our firm belief that every child deserves a safe and nurturing environment, free from the clutches of exploitation and abuse. Our country was built on the principles of justice, compassion, and the protection of individual rights. It is disheartening to witness the continued suffering of innocent children who are falling victim to this horrifying crime.

We firmly believe that justice will prevail, and those responsible for perpetuating these heinous acts will face the consequences of their actions. Through the force of the Holy Spirit and the unwavering determination of individuals and organizations fighting against child sex trafficking, we remain hopeful that a brighter future awaits these young souls.

As members of the media, you have a powerful platform to inform and educate the public about pressing societal issues. We urge you to use your influence and resources to shed light on the alarming realities of child sex trafficking at our southern borders. It is crucial that the American people are not kept in the dark by our government, but rather empowered with the knowledge and awareness necessary to drive meaningful change.

We implore you to initiate investigative journalism, publish compelling stories, and engage in thought-provoking discussions that bring attention to this pressing issue. By doing so, you will not only help raise public awareness but also encourage our government to prioritize the eradication of child sex trafficking and the protection of our nation's most precious resource‚Äîthe children.

Let us join hands and work together to ensure that our society provides a safe and secure future for all children. By uniting our voices, we can demand the necessary actions and policies to end child sex trafficking, bring the perpetrators to justice, and provide support and healing for the survivors.

Thank you for your time, attention, and dedication to your vital role as a guardian of truth and justice. Together, we can make a difference and create a world where God's children are not for sale.

May the force of the Holy Spirit guide us in our pursuit of justice.

Respectfully,
